item.title: Volt party elects Sophie In ‘T Veld and the German Damian Boeselager
item.description: The Dutch Sophie In ‘T Veld and the German Damian Boeselager were chosen in Brussels as lead candidates in the European elections for Volt.

item.title: Slovakia holds second presidential vote amid division over Ukraine
item.description: Slovakia holds second presidential vote amid controversy and division over Ukraine war.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 6th – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Russian bombards Kharkiv overnight
item.description: Russian forces attacked Kharkiv overnight, killing several.

item.title: World Food Programme warns of imminent famine in northern Gaza
item.description: As the war in Gaza enters a sixth month, the WFP said malnutrition among children is spreading at record pace, and one of three below the age of two is now acutely malnourished.

item.title: Armani subsidiary shut down for ‘exploiting workers’
item.description: Italian police disclosed that Chinese workers employed by an unauthorised subcontractor, produced handbags and accessories for Giorgio Armani.

item.title: Sarajevo marks the 32nd anniversary of the city's siege
item.description: In Sarajevo, thousands of shoes have been carefully arranged along the city streets to remember those who perished during the Bosnian war.

item.title: 11,000 people evacuated due to imminent risk of flooding in Russia
item.description: Some 11,000 people have had to be evacuated after a dam broke in the city of Orsk, Russia which has a population of 190,000, on the border with Kazakhstan.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 6th – Midday
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: EU and Ukraine explore special tribunal for Putin and war officials
item.description: Vladimir Putin and other senior Russian political and military officials could have a special tribunal set up by the EU and Ukraine.

item.title: Lampedusa overwhelmed after receiving over 1000 migrants in a day
item.description: Italian authorities reported that just in a day and a half, more than 1500 people arrived to Lampedusa island, with 333 at the Friday morning alone.

item.title: Israel not doing enough to protect civilians, say UN and EU
item.description: UN and EU say that Israel does not take "adequate" measures to provide humanitarian aid and to protect civilian lives.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 6th – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: EU's most threatening criminal networks enter legal economy
item.description: Crime webs are penetrating legitimate businesses across the 27-nation bloc, relying heavily on corruption to develop their activities.

item.title: Amputee event in Baku raises awareness for International Mine Day
item.description: "Mines are a huge global problem," said Vugar Suleymanov, Chairman of the Board of the Mine Action Agency of Azerbaijan.

item.title: 'Take care of the planet': Lionel Messi joins fight against climate change
item.description: The Argentinian footballer wants to extend his influence beyond the world of sport.

item.title: Poland's LGBT+ couples travel abroad to tie the knot
item.description: Poland's new government has promised a more inclusive law regulating civil partnerships, but this could still be a long way off.

item.title: Norway becomes latest European state to boost defence spending
item.description: Earlier this month, oil-rich Norway said it wants to increase the number of conscripted soldiers from 9,000 to 13,500 by 2036.

item.title: German synagogue attacked with incendiary device
item.description: Antisemitic attacks in Germany and elsewhere have surged since the start of the Israel Hamas war on 7 October.

item.title: WATCH: Crane accident kills one in Florida
item.description: One person was killed and two others hospitalised on Thursday afternoon when a section of crane fell from a building in downtown Fort Lauderdale, according to officials.

item.title: Russian officials again try to link Moscow concert attack to Ukraine despite Kyiv's denials
item.description: The attack on the Crocus venue was claimed by an affiliate of the Islamic State terror group, which recruits heavily from former Soviet states in central Asia.

item.title: Earthquake rattles New York and nearby area
item.description: The rare 4.8 magnitude quake struck Friday morning.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 5th – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: ‘The place to be’: Art Paris 2024 thrusts the French gallery scene into the spotlight
item.description: In its 26th edition, Art Paris stays true to its roots as the annual art fair that puts the French creative scene on an international stage.

item.title: United Ireland would cost €20 billion for 20 years, new study finds
item.description: Brexit, demographic change and political turmoil in Northern Ireland have left many wondering if reunification could come sooner than expected.

item.title: Queer in Poland: When can the LGBTQ+ community expect equal rights?
item.description: The LGBTQ+ community in Poland has long advocated against the erosion of human rights after years of rule-of-law concerns. Euronews reporter Julian Lopez travels to Warsaw to speak with activists and community members about their hopes - and fears - for the future.

item.title: Orbán backs Bosnian EU accession ahead of controversial visit to separatist leader
item.description: European and American leaders are increasingly worried about rising interethnic tensions stirred up by agitators in the Western Balkans.

item.title: Slovakia prepares for an election that could change its relationship with Europe
item.description: The recent election of a populist government has pulled the country away from the European mainstream.

item.title: Heavy gunfire near Haiti's presidential palace sparks panic among residents
item.description: Haitians looking to buy supplies in what used to be a busy market in Port-au-Prince fled in fear on Thursday as gangs clashed with police in front of the presidential palace.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 5th – Midday
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: US Secretary of State Blinken insists 'Ukraine will become a member of NATO'
item.description: A summit to mark the alliance's birthday doubled as a renewed effort to keep members on board with aid for Ukraine.

item.title: Lethal Gaza aid convoy strike sparks row between Poland and Israel
item.description: The two countries had recently begun a rapprochement after the fall of a nationalist government in Warsaw that indulged in Holocaust revisionism.

item.title: Israeli army dismisses 2 officers, Tel Aviv to open two humanitarian routes into Gaza
item.description: The latest developments from the war in Gaza.

item.title: Serbia police arrest 2 men accused of hitting 2-year-old girl with car and dumping her body
item.description: Serbian authorities continue to search for the body of the toddler Danka Ilic, who was reported missing last month.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 5th – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Macron: France and allies 'could have stopped' 1994 Rwanda genocide
item.description: In a statement, French President Emmanuel Macron said France and its allies could have done more to stop the 1994 Rwandan genocide.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 4th – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Russian human rights defender Oleg Orlov turns 71 in prison
item.description: Russia's oldest human rights organisation has said the critic of the war in Ukraine is being treated inhumanely.

item.title: WATCH: Around 1,000 migrants land in Lampedusa in 24 hours
item.description: Dozens of small boats from Tunisia and Libya were also rescued off the Italian island overnight.

item.title: At least 4 killed in Russian drone attacks on Kharkiv
item.description: Ukraine's second-largest city also suffered aerial attacks on its power plant, part of a pattern of strikes on civilian energy infrastructure.

item.title: I am running for the next UN Secretary-General. This is why my bid matters
item.description: The UN chief is chosen in an opaque process by countries seeking to uphold the status quo without any public involvement. This results in the selection of the person that will upset the least, or appease the most of those hyper-polarized powers, Colombe Cahen-Salvador writes.

item.title: Italian Deputy Prime Minister Matteo Salvini survives no-confidence vote
item.description: The far-right politician has been accused of having links with the Kremlin - something he now strenuously denies.

item.title: Judges urge UK government to halt arms sales to Israel after aid convoy strike
item.description: Rishi Sunak is one of many world leaders under pressure to reassess his government's support for Israel.

item.title: As NATO turns 75, this is how it can overcome complacency and reinforce transatlantic security
item.description: The take-home message is that another 75 years of NATO really shouldn’t be taken for granted, Dylan Macchiarini Crosson writes.

item.title: Huge unexploded WWII bomb discovered in Germany
item.description: The discovery of the half-tonne device in Cologne's Rhine River during construction led to shipping closures and evacuations.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 4th – Midday
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Taiwanese TV presenter reports an earthquake live as it shakes her studio
item.description: Taiwan’s SETTV captured the moment a 7.2-magnitude earthquake hit on Wednesday morning live as anchorwomen described strong shaking while trying to keep their balance.

item.title: Landmines are being used again. Bold UN action must help their post-conflict victims
item.description: A generation after the Ottawa mine ban treaty, a new conflict sees the use of land mines rise again. The new UN Human Rights Council action could be used to hold states accountable in post-war decontamination and support for victims, six notable human rights advocates write.

item.title: Croatian retailers raise the alarm over effects of Sunday trading law
item.description: The summer's tourism season promises will test how much the country's economy relies on shops staying open all week.

item.title: Migrants relocated from Paris ahead of Olympic Games
item.description: Aid groups fear the move, which included mostly women and children, is the beginning of a broader effort by Paris authorities to clear people out by the summer.
